text:
Hey guys it’s Ro! Welcome to another Nerdy
Nummies!

I have been playing a lot of app games lately
and you guys know me, I love games

with food in them. And, I’ve fallen in love
with one recently called Farm Heroes.

They just came out with their new game Farm
Heroes Super Saga,

I really enjoyed playing this game and worked
with King Games who supported

this video to make some treats today. For those
of you who might not be

familiar with Farm Heroes, it’s a farming
themed match game, it’s very fun

and easy to play. You need to match 3 Cropsies
to collect them and put them

in your crate. And, if you get 4 Cropsies
in a 4 square, they become

Super Cropsies, and in this case bigger is
better!
You can also get more points this way.

So in honor of the new game, today we are
gonna be making Cropsie Themed Cookies.
Let’s get started!

The recipe that we’re gonna be making today
is a vanilla almond homemade cookie

recipe, this one is from the Nerdy Nummies
Cookbook.

The things you will need, will be: 3 Cups
of all purpose flour, 3/4 cup of

almond meal, 1-1/2 cups of sugar, 2 sticks
of salted butter at room temperature,

1/8 a teaspoon of salt, 1 teaspoon of baking
powder, 1/2 a teaspoon of ground

nutmeg, 1/2 a teaspoon of almond extract,
1-1/2 teaspoons of vanilla extract,

and 2 eggs. Then you will also need some different
cookie cutters for the

Cropsie Characters. In the game they are so
cute! Over here I’ve got a water

drop cookie cutter, a plum, banana, pear,
carrot… I think this one was

technically a strawberry, but it looks just
fine as a carrot!

And, a little tomato. Now let’s put it all
together!

The first thing that we’re gonna do in a
medium bowl, we are gonna whisk

together our dry ingredients, flour, almond
meal, salty-salty, baking powder

and nutmeg. Then whisk together until well
combined and then we’re gonna set
it off to the side.

Next, in a large mixing bowl we are gonna
cream together our butter and sugar.

We are gonna mix together until everything
is light and fluffy.
Now we are gonna mix in our eggs 1 at a time.

Add your first egg, mix it up, then scrape
down the sides, add your second
egg, mix it up, and scrape down the sides.

After we have mixed in our eggs we are going
to add both of our extracts,

vanilla and almond, then mix together until
well combined.

Everything is mixed together and now we are
gonna add our dry ingredients

to our butter mixture, I’m gonna be adding
it 1/2 at a time so that it

won’t create a big dust cloud. Mix together,
then scrape down the sides

then pour the other 1/2 in, mix together and
scrape down the sides.

Mmmmm! Our cookie dough is now ready, I’ve
divided it into 2 parts, we are

gonna shape the dough into 2 discs and wrap
them up with food safe plastic wrap

and then pop these in the fridge for about
1 hour to chill.

Our dough is ready, it has chilled in the
fridge, and now we are gonna roll it out.

And I’ve got it right here, we’ve gotta
unwrap it and I’m gonna do a little bit
of what I call baking flair.
Just grab it like this, and give it a tug!

We’re gonna take a little pinch of flour,
sprinkle it down on top of the surface

so that the dough won’t stick. Put a little
flour on top, a little flour

on my rolling pin. And then I’m gonna roll
it out about 1/4 inch thick.

Alright, this is looking good, I’ve got
all the cookie cutters over here,

and we’re gonna cut out as many as you can.
I’m gonna start with the little plum.

I’m gonna place it right here on top of
a baking sheet lined with a piece

of parchment paper. Then I’ll do a little
carrot, a tomato. There’s plenty

of cookie dough to make many of these little
Cropsies, but I’m just placing

6 Cropsies on each baking sheet so that they
have plenty of room.

After you have your cookies on your baking
sheet you’re gonna pop these into

the freezer for 10 minutes to set, and then
we’re gonna bake them.

You’re gonna heat your oven to 350 degrees
and bake for about 12-13 minutes.

Once your cookies have baked and had plenty
of time to cool, now it’s time

to decorate. Over here I’ve got a bunch
of royal icing in different

plastic baggies, with tips at the end for
a little bit more design control.

The colors that I dyed the royal icing are
red, orange, yellow, green, blue,

purple, white, light brown and this is very
dark brown.

Over here on this cutting board, I’ve got
1 of each type of Cropsie Cookie.

And the first thing that we’re gonna do
is pipe an outline.

So I’m gonna start with blue and we’re
gonna do the little water drop

character. Just pipe an outline all the way
around.

Then we're gonna pipe outlines on each of our cookies
using the correct colors.

On some of the fruits and vegetables, I’m
not gonna pipe the stems.

Once your cookies are outlined, I’ve let
them sit out for just a few minutes,

so that the outline layer of royal icing hardens
a little bit, so it will

hold shape. Now we’re gonna fill them in,
which in the baking world is

called flooding. I like to make zig-zags,
back and forth, back and forth

and then using a toothpick, moving the icing
around so that it’s all touching,

all connecting. Then we’re gonna fill in
the rest of our cookies, continuing

to match the colors. After you’ve filled
in all the cookies, again you’re gonna

want to let them set for a few minutes, I
like to take my finger and gently

touch the top, and if I feel that it’s hardened
and dry, I know I can decorate

some more! Now I’m gonna take my white royal
icing, I’m gonna pipe all of their

little eyeballs. All of the eyeballs for the
different Cropsie characters are

different, so I’m just looking on my phone
and trying to match what they look like.

Time for more decoration details on the eyes.
We are gonna be piping iris’ and
the pupils on each little character.

It’s just good to note that their iris is
gonna be the same color as their body.

Lastly I’m just taking a little white royal
icing and I’m just putting a little
dot on each eyeball.

These are so cute, they’re really starting
to look like the Cropsies, look,
look at that little face! Aw!

But, they’re not done yet we have a few
more details. Again, using the dark brown,

I’m gonna pipe a line on top of each eyelid,
just giving it a little bit more

personality and definition. And our little
plum gets some eyelashes!
Oooh-oooh-oooh!

These are starting to look adorable! We just
finished the eyes, now we are going

to decorate the mouth. All of our characters
are going to get a light brown
mouth, with a top line of dark brown for definition.

And some of the characters will get a little
white royal icing, for their teeth!

Final decoration step is we are going to ice
the little stems on all the

Cropsies characters. Remember, the water does
not have a stem, and the pear is
the only one that we are gonna be icing brown.
But the rest of them are all green!

Ta-da! Here are the Cropsie Themed Cookies,
from the new game
Farm Heroes Super Saga, that we made today!

Each little Cropsie has it’s own personality,
the 2 that are my favorite, that

I think I’m the most like, are the pear
and the banana!

The banana is excitable and a little bit crazy,
and the pear is sassy, feisty

and kind. If you guys play the game, let me
know in the comments down below which

little Cropsie personality you are most like.
Maybe you’re like the carrot,

who’s confident, cheeky, ah-hee-hee-hee!
And happy!

I’ll be taking lots of pictures of these
cookies and posting them on Facebook,

Tumblr, Instagram and Twitter, and if you
guys make these, please take a

picture and send it to me, I just love seeing
your baking creations, it just
makes me happy, it makes my day.

A big thank you to King Games for supporting
and collaborating with me to

make this video. If you guys are interested
in checking out this cute game
I’ll be putting a link down below.

And, if you have any other ideas for any other
Nerdy Nummies, please let me know,

leave me a comment down below and I will do
my best to make it happen!
Alright, thanks again you guys, bye-bye!
